===Origin===
The [[Enclave (Himalayas)|Enclave]]{{r|Wolverine: Killing #1}} was the refuge of an [[Inhomo supremis|Inhuman]] group in the [[Himalayan Mountains]], [[Tibet]].{{r|Wolverine: Weapon X Files #1|; [[Tribune (Tane) (Earth-616)|Tribune]]'s entry}}

That group had splintered due to opposition to the usage of the [[Terrigen Mist]].{{r|Wolverine: Weapon X Files #1|; [[Tribune (Tane) (Earth-616)|Tribune]]'s entry}}

===The Mandate===
The members of the Enclave followed the '''Mandate''', their sacred law, which dictated them to stay isolated in order to remain pure and perfect, enforced by the [[Tribune (Tane) (Earth-616)|Tribune, Tane]].{{r|Wolverine: Killing #1}}{{r|Wolverine: Weapon X Files #1|; [[Tribune (Tane) (Earth-616)|Tribune]]'s entry}} That Mandate was applied also by killing any outsiders.{{r|Wolverine: Killing #1}}

===Nirissa's plan===
As monstrous mutations occurred in the Enclave's small gene pool,{{r|Wolverine: Weapon X Files #1|; [[Tribune (Tane) (Earth-616)|Tribune]]'s entry}} including the monstrous [[Slith (Earth-616)|Slith]], {{r|Wolverine: Killing #1}} [[Nirissa (Earth-616)|Matriarch Nirissa]] convinced Tane to agree to her plan of arranging her daughter [[Serra (Inhuman) (Earth-616)|Serra]] (whom Tane wished to marry) to have children with the [[Homo superior|mutant]] [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Wolverine]], for her grandchildren and their descendants to acquire his healing factor.{{r|Wolverine: Killing #1}}{{r|Wolverine: Weapon X Files #1|; [[Tribune (Tane) (Earth-616)|Tribune]]'s entry}}
